item.title: GetTextAtEx error (possibly with finding the font?)
item.dc:creator: @yimboli yimboli
item.description:
@yimboli wrote:

[quote=“Wizzup?, post:4, topic:364463”]http://wizzup.org/simbadoc/scriptref/ocr.html :-)[/quote]Thanks for the reply. I have already seen the documentation on your website, and I appreciate your efforts. Still, the link you posted does not help to eliminate the error.

Perhaps you can post a script with GetTextAtEx() in it, which you confirm will execute on your computer? I don’t care if it finds text accurately, only that it executes so I can show you my error with the same code. I can’t even get my code to execute… one step at a time…

[code]program new;

var Text : string;

begin
Text := GetTextAtEx(19, 308, 106, 322, 0, 0, 0, -1, 100, ‘Times New Roman’);
writeln(Text);
end.
end.[/code]

The above code gives me this error:

Compiled succesfully in 31 ms.
Error: Exception: Access violation at line 6

So it compiles but hits an access violation.

Read full topic

item.title: GetTextAtEx error (possibly with finding the font?)
item.dc:creator: @yimboli yimboli
item.description:
@yimboli wrote:

First, the script:

[code]program new;

var Text : string;

begin
Text := GetTextAtEx(19, 308, 106, 322, 0, 0, 0, 100, 0, ‘Times New Roman’);
writeln(Text);
end.[/code]

Now, the error:
“Compiled succesfully in 15 ms.
Error: Exception: Access violation at line 6”

I’ve shifted to Simba because I use Vista and SCAR’s LoadCharsFromFont2() function is broken on Vista, I believe because the Fonts are handled differently and/or are in a different location.

Is this the same with Simba?

I’m just trying to error-check before I click on a link by making sure the Text is what I want it to be. If someone has a better suggestion on how to click a text link after verifying that its text equals a certain string, I’m open to suggestions.

Read full topic
item.source: GetTextAtEx error (possibly with finding the font?)
